item.title: Scandal-scarred Democrat refuses to quit key role
item.description: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi pleaded Wednesday with Rep. William Jefferson to resign from the House Ways and Means Committee days after FBI agents raided his Capitol Hill office. "With respect, I decline to do so," Jefferson responded. Jefferson is the subject of a criminal probe into allegations that he took bribes in return for using his office to facilitate business ventures in Africa.

item.title: Rape, brutality ignored to aid Congo peace
item.description: At a makeshift recreation center at a hospital in eastern Congo, about 500 women surround a young woman lying on the floor. Tintsi arrived at the hospital three weeks ago on a stretcher carried by relatives who walked 100 miles to get her help. Tintsi, like every woman in the room, is a victim of the worst kind of sexual violation imaginable. "It's a kind of barbarity that only savages are capable of," said Dr. Denis Mukwege Mukengere.

item.title: Saddam Hussein's nephew arrested
item.description: A nephew of Saddam Hussein, one of Iraq's most wanted criminals, was arrested in Beirut, Lebanon, by Iraqi security services, with the help of Interpol, according to the office of Iraq's prime minister Wednesday.
